Description: Pendant earring: the earring is in a pale gold and is fairly crudely worked. The upper part of the ornament is a crescentic plaque with a symmetrical series of volutes below, formed of repoussé-gold sheet. An S-shaped hook is soldered to the back and the wire runs up to support a bead within the horns of the crescent. Hanging from three loops, which are attached behind the volutes, are wires covered by narrow cones of sheet gold, and terminating in beads. One of the suspended beads is hollow glass. The other beads appear to be pearls.
Curator's comments: Pair with 1917,0601.2673. Bibliography: F. H. Marshall, ‘Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum’ (1911), no. 2672; S. Walker, 'Ancient Faces', New York 2000, pp. 153 [106].
Bibliographic references: Jewellery / Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum. (2672)
Walker, S 2000 / Ancient Faces: Mummy Portraits from Roman Egypt (106)
Yeroulanou 1999 / Diatrita: Gold Pierced-Work Jewellery from the 3rd to the 7th Century (461)
Exhibition history: 1997 22 Oct-1998 30 Apr, Italy, Rome, Fondaione Memmo, Ancient Faces 2018 23 Feb – 22 Apr, Nashville, Frist Art Museum, 'Rome; City &Empire' 2018-2019 20 Sep-04 Feb, Canberra, National Museum of Australia, 'Rome; City &Empire' 2021 13 Feb-15 Aug, Belgium, Tongeren, Gallo-Romeins Museum, 'Rome; City & Empire' 2021-2022 25 Sep – 08 Oct, China, Suzhou Museum, 'Rome: City & Empire'
Acquisition name: Bequeathed by: Sir Augustus Wollaston Franks
